This discovery motivated Darwin to think more deeply about the concept of

“species variation.”

Does that mean one species can slowly change into another species?

Long ago,

a flock of finches from

South America likely got caught in a violent storm

and ended up on the

Galapagos Islands.

They then

spread out among

the islands, acquiring their own territory, and ended up staying

there.

But the plants available for food existed in slightly different forms on each island.

Over time, the birds’ beaks must have slowly changed to become more suitable for eating

the available vegetation.


137
